S:log-item.D:comment:
DERBY-1793
Increasing the maximum time to wait for the server to start up from 30 to 60 seconds. The test checks in 500ms increments, so this change does not increase the time for test to run for those who are already successfully running it. So far this change has made this test pass in my environment, where previously it failed consistently. Since this test passes in the nightly full test runs across a number of environments I assume the network server startup time is somehow related to my particular machine (processor, memory, disk frag, firewall , vpn, ...)
Others have seen this issue so I am committing to the codeline. I have filed a separate issue that work should be done to measure the performance of network server startup as a targeted test (DERBY-1794).
